posts.name: Will Rhodes
posts.cooked:
Welcome to the Threshold DAO delegate thread!

This is the hub to nominate yourself to become a Threshold DAO delegate or to find quality Threshold DAO contributors to delegate your vote weight to

As always if you have any q’s hop into the Threshold discord server.

Reply to this forum post with the following information to get started as a Threshold DAO delegate:

Discord Name:

Delegate ETH Address:

Why I want to be a Threshold delegate:

I confirm that:

I’m willing and able to participate in governance of the upcoming DAO. I understand this is an ongoing role that requires active participation: (Agree/Disagree/Comment)
I understand that delegates are unpaid volunteers. Being a delegate does not qualify me for immediate payment in tokens: (Agree/Disagree/Comment)

Threshold DAO and / or other web3 qualifications:

Additional Links (optional):

Check out the rest of this post for more information on Threshold DAO delegates

What is a Threshold delegate?

A Threshold delegate is a DAO member who aligns strongly with the mission of the Threshold Network to leverage cryptographic tools that ensure full control of users’ digital assets.

Delegates provide ETH addresses that other Threshold token holders and Threshold stakers can delegate their vote weight to. This never involves the transferring or custody of assets but rather just the vote weight those assets represent in the Threshold DAO. Furthermore, vote weight can be redelegated at any time.

Delegates are responsible for voting on Threshold governance proposals with this vote weight that others have assigned to them.

Why do delegates exist?

Delegates exist because not everyone is able to fully commit to following Threshold governance and spending enough time considering every single DAO proposal. Allowing DAO members to delegate means they can still have an indirect say in the DAO, without having to be involved with day-to-day governance. Instead, they select active DAO members who have demonstrated solid commitment to Threshold to make decisions with their token weight and stake weight for them.

What do delegates do?

Delegates are volunteers who actively participate in Threshold governance and wish to grow their influence over key decisions in both the Threshold Token Holder DAO and the Threshold Staker DAO.

Delegates are expected to actively participate in all Threshold governance proposals while ensuring to make well researched and informed decisions.

Essentially, becoming a delegate means that other people are trusting your ability to make great on-chain decisions for the entire network.

Time commitment?

Voting on proposals is easy. Taking time to participate in governance discussion and ensure a proper understanding of what each proposal means… not as much.

Becoming a delegate does not require a hard time commitment to the DAO. For reference, so far there have been around 21 Threshold Improvement Proposals. The amount of time required is directly correlated to the amount of proposals that go through our on-chain governance system.

Compensation?

Delegates are volunteers, and there’s no established compensation for their contribution to governance.

If you are interested in earning T to help build the Threshold network check out our DAO guilds under the #daocontribute channel in our Discord server.

Who should be a delegate?

Anyone who understands the commitment to the DAO a delegate is making, is excited about Threshold governance and wants to directly grow their influence on the future of the network. This can be existing Threshold DAO contributors or members of other web3 communities.

To delegate liquid token vote weight, follow this guide from our DAO’s Notion hub.

To delegate staked token vote weight, follow this guide from our DAO’s Notion hub.

posts.name: MrsNuBooty
posts.cooked:
Discord Name: MrsNuBooty#0350

Delegate ETH Address: mrsnu.eth
0x4f1eFe177057DB679A7Cbe1cf92aCf2aD5B7aA74

Why I want to be a Threshold delegate: I have a strong commitment to the Threshold DAO and community. I started bridging the NuCypher and Keep Network communities in April of 2021 and have been a driving force of all community led initiatives. I currently lead the Threshold Marketing Guild and am an inaugural member of the Threshold Marketing Guild Committee.

While I am still learning more every day and might not be capable of forming the right conclusion independently, I have an acute ability to hear others and ask the right questions to make informed and educated decisions for the network. I am not afraid to send my favorite community members a line asking them to explain something to me like I’m 5. The great part is that our community is filled with people that will take the time out of their day to help others learn and grow.

I confirm that:

I’m willing and able to participate in governance of the upcoming DAO. I understand this is an ongoing role that requires active participation: ( Agree /Disagree/Comment)

I understand that delegates are unpaid volunteers. Being a delegate does not qualify me for immediate payment in tokens: ( Agree /Disagree/Comment)

Threshold DAO and other web3 qualifications:

Member of the Threshold Marketing Guild Committee
A leader of the Threshold Marketing Guild
A contributor to the Threshold Integrations Guild
An observer of the Threshold Treasury Guild
A TallyHo Corgi Pack Leader & Moderator

A few contributions I have made to the Threshold DAO:

Created various art for promoting Threshold
Staking Art Announcement
Twitter Launch Announcement
Twitter Launch Announcement v2
First 100 Threshold Wallets POAP
Celebrating Twitter Growth

Hosted various Threshold events:
The weekly T Party has been going on for 25 weeks now.
Creaton AMA
NuLink AMA

Written various content:
Merger update
Blog addressing inflation being halted

My all time fav governance conversation
Binance Learn & Earn 2.0 Funding

posts.name: Nico
posts.cooked:
Discord Name: Nico186# 5010

Delegate ETH Address: 0x640cC25c296b1Cc636b1f711F1c9652eC11C4630

Why I want to be a Threshold delegate:

I am an active member of the Threshold Discord and Twitter Communities, T -holder, avid project enthusiast, and currently hold an elected to position to the Marketing Guild. I would like to continue my contributions and participation by self-nominating to the Threshold Council.

I originally learned of the Threshold Network as a member of the KEEP Community and participated in the historic on-chain merger and DAO Formation. This involvement has taught me great deal about the project and community, the long term product vision, and shared web3 values of the community, and I am very interested in joining the Threshold Council.

I confirm that:

I’m willing and able to participate in governance of the upcoming DAO. I understand this is an ongoing role that requires active participation: (Agree/Disagree/Comment)
I understand that delegates are unpaid volunteers. Being a delegate does not qualify me for immediate payment in tokens: (Agree/Disagree/Comment)

Threshold DAO and / or other web3 qualifications:

I originally joined the KEEP Project as a test nest participant, learning about node operation, decentralization, and the day to day operations of onboarding and (digital) community management.

I was elected to the Marketing Guild in the Fall of 2022 and continue to serve and contribute to the DAO. My primary role is to host and coordinate Voice Calls, organize campaigns, and participating in Eth Denver.

I additionally work as a Moderator, host, and Sheppard (community onboarding) for the Tally Ho Wallet. We have built our community from a mere 200 to over 70,000 members. I host a weekly call and manage discord.

I have personally been involved in crypto since 2018 when I began following Etherium, early NFT projects, and learning about smart contracts. I feel that these qualifications, alongside my professional practice experience will lend themselves to my continuing contributions to the DAO.

posts.name: oleole
posts.cooked:
Discord Name: oleole#4423

Delegate ETH Address: 0xC120Ab7977BdDa3b57F191DBF41A1Af7DA794bAa

Why I want to be a Threshold delegate: It has been more than two years since I operated a node for the Nucypher worklock and now for the Threshold network. I have always believed in the project’s prospects and future, holding tokens and participating in governance. The only weakness was in the Chinese community’s content and marketing, and my English is only at the level of written communication, so I was not able to deeply participate in the contribution to the DAO. After this suggestion from @MrsNuBooty on Twitter, I also realized that I might be able to take this opportunity to start from self-nomination and voting to represent, and more deeply participate in the contribution to the Threshold network. As we all know, China is a huge market, and there are countless people in the Chinese region who believe in the future of web3 and are like-minded, which can also allow friends in the Chinese community like me who are not very proficient in English and want to learn more about T to communicate and pay attention to the progress of the project, and expand consensus.

I confirm that: I’m willing and able to participate in governance of the upcoming DAO. I understand this is an ongoing role that requires active participation: (Agree)
I understand that delegates are unpaid volunteers. Being a delegate does not qualify me for immediate payment in tokens: (Agree)

Threshold DAO and / or other web3 qualifications: I entered the blockchain/web3 field in 2017. I have operated a Nucypher node and have been an active PRE/tBTC node staker. I worked as an operation manager for Odaily, one of the top three blockchain industry media in China, for more than three years.

posts.name: John Packel
posts.cooked:
Discord Name: john_packel#7451

Delegate ETH Address: 0x72063b0b19999F6f267BE9e66d95496385fc03E9

Why I want to be a Threshold delegate:

I am confident my experience with Threshold and beyond can be beneficial to people who may not have as much time to devote to following the myriad opportunities and questions facing this project now and in our exciting future.

I identify with Jake’s statement above regarding committing blood, sweat and tears to Threshold. As you see listed below, I’ve been involved with Keep for nearly 6 years and Threshold since inception. I significantly increased my activities starting in October 2022, and since mid-November I’ve spent 30-40 hours a week between roles on the Marketing and Treasury Guild committees, as well as on other DAO-wide activities (I’m currently compensated as a guild member and for up to 22 additional hours/week spent on a temporary role leading multiple Marketing Guild workstreams).

I commit to voting on every issue, as well as posting my reasoning on this forum, so anyone considering delegating can determine how well my views reflect theirs. I also welcome dialog here, in Discord and on twitter (including direct message).

I confirm that:

I’m willing and able to participate in governance of the upcoming DAO. I understand this is an ongoing role that requires active participation: Agree

I understand that delegates are unpaid volunteers. Being a delegate does not qualify me for any payment in tokens: Agree

Threshold DAO and / or other web3 qualifications:

  • Advisor to Keep Project since 2017
  • Active and significant staker in tBTC v1 from inception
  • Contributed to initial guild structure & helped found Threshold’s Marketing Guild in early 2022
  • Served on inaugural Guild committee (waived compensation); in September 2022 re-elected to 12-month role
  • Joined the Treasury Guild in November 2022 and have attended every meeting of Integrations Guild since then, as well
  • Engage constructively in daily Discord discussions, as well as Forum proposals and Snapshot votes
  • Authored this proposal for a Communications role (highlights some of my career background), this Marketing Guild budget request and this update to Council election process
  • Involved with crypto since 2013; worked at ConsenSys for several years and maintain a strong network in Web3

Additional
My Twitter profile/posts: https://twitter.com/Crypto_Socrates

(While I’m a fan of Ancient Greek writers and thinkers, I don’t claim to be the “crypto Socrates”; that was a handle I originally set for asking questions, but switched to it as my main account when I got locked out of my original.)

LinkedIn (not yet updated to reflect my current focus on Threshold instead of my former company): https://www.linkedin.com/in/johnpackel/

Delegate ETH Address: 0x8122158AaabA26eA9e6fB3eD2dfe3fb6B4D9Bd32

Why I want to be a Threshold delegate:

As an active member of the Threshold community, I am deeply invested in the project’s mission, and I’ve held several roles within the DAO along the years, including an elected position in the Threshold Council last year, and Keep Network multi-sig member. Given my dedication and contributions to the community, I self-nominate for a position on the Threshold DAO delegates to continue my work towards supporting the network’s long-term vision.

My involvement with Threshold started through the KEEP Community, and I have been actively engaged with the project since its inception, participating in various on-chain events and DAO-wide activities. Through my experience, I have gained a comprehensive understanding of the project, community, and shared values that are central to Threshold’s long-term vision.

As a delegate, I will protect the DAO’s credibly neutral platform long-term vision. My voting decisions will reflect these goals, and I will make sure to post my reasoning on the forum to encourage constructive dialogue with the community. I am passionate about advancing privacy technologies and decentralized finance, which aligns with the Threshold network’s mission.
